_meta.notes: Federal brackets (single/default) and example state rates. For audit-grade results, ingest IRS Pub 15-T wage-bracket tables (per-frequency) and each state's official withholding tables (PDFs) and store PDF->row mappings.

config.notes: Pre-tax retirement (401k, pretax HSA) may reduce federal taxable income; some pre-tax items may not reduce Social Security/Medicare base â€” consult plan type and IRS rules.

tables.note: For per-period wage-bracket lookups use IRS Pub 15-T tables keyed by pay frequency and filing status. Those tables should be parsed into tables.monthly|biweekly|weekly.{filingStatus} arrays for O(1) lookup and mapping to the PDF page/row.

metadata.document_title: Social Security - Contribution and Benefit Base (SSA factsheet)
metadata.quote: Social Security tax rate (employee) 6.2% on wages up to the annual wage base.
Medicare tax rate 1.45% (no wage base). Additional 0.9% applies to high earners.

metadata.document_title: Questions and Answers for the Additional Medicare Tax
metadata.page_or_section: Additional Medicare tax rules and thresholds
metadata.quote: Employers must withhold Additional Medicare Tax of 0.9% on wages paid to an employee after the employee's wages exceed $200,000 in a calendar year.
Employer matches Social Security 6.2% up to wage base and Medicare 1.45%.
Employer Medicare share is 1.45% (no Additional Medicare employer share).

metadata.page_or_section: FUTA tax rate and wage base
metadata.quote: FUTA statutory rate 6.0% with credits; effective typical rate 0.6% after state credit; applied to first $7,000 of wages per employee.

subnational.note: State withholding rules vary significantly. For each state, ingest the state's withholding tables published by the state's Dept. of Revenue or Department of Taxation.

reference.document_title: Federation of Tax Administrators - State Tax Agencies
reference.quote: Use each state's official pages for state-specific withholding tables and rules.

sources.quote: Primary source for per-period withholding tables and percentage method.
Source for Social Security wage base values and historical series.
